properties.headline: Flood Watch issued January 27 at 2:22PM PST until January 28 at 2:00PM PST by NWS Portland OR
properties.description:
The Flood Watch continues for

* A portion of Southwest Washington, including the following
areas, South Washington Coast and Willapa Hills.

* Through Tuesday afternoon

* Heavy rain is expected in the Willapa Hills this evening.
Expected rainfall of one and a half to three inches will cause
sharp rises, and may be enough to cause flooding of small
streams and rivers draining out of the Willapa Hills.

* The river with the greatest concern of flooding is the Grays
River in Wahkiakum County since it responds quickly to
excessive rainfall.
properties.instruction:
A Flood Watch means there is a potential for flooding based on
current forecasts. Monitor later forecasts and be alert for
possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding
should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

Landslides and debris flows are possible during this flood event.
People, structures and roads located below steep slopes, in
canyons and near the mouths of canyons may be at serious risk
from rapidly moving landslides.

NWSheadline: FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON
